description: Have you wanted to see what this programming thing is all about? Do you have issues figuring out where to start? Well, this course will show you how to get things set up and start with the basics of programming using the Python programming language. If you want to set up your machine, understand the basics of Python, and start understanding the basic tenets of programming, then please join us!

name: Programming Fundamentals
subtitle: Starting your programming adventure...

episodes.description: Have you wanted to see what this programming thing is all about? Do you have issues figuring out where to start? Well, this course will show you how to get things set up and start with the basics of programming using the Python programming language. If you want to set up your machine, understand the basics of Python, and start understanding the basic tenets of programming, then please join us!
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.047 --> 00:00:04.300
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:06.227 --> 00:00:07.850
Hello, everyone and welcome to DEVPRO.TV.

3
00:00:07.850 --> 00:00:11.890
This is a course overview for
our Programming Fundamentals Series.

4
00:00:11.890 --> 00:00:14.230
And here to help us is Mr.
Justin Dennison.

5
00:00:14.230 --> 00:00:17.140
So, Justin, what is this course all about.

6
00:00:17.140 --> 00:00:21.220
>> So this course is to really get us
ingrained in some of the syntax that we're

7
00:00:21.220 --> 00:00:25.930
going to encounter when embarking in
programming in the python programming

8
00:00:25.930 --> 00:00:30.190
language but also to look at programming
constructs that we may encounter.

9
00:00:30.190 --> 00:00:32.710
Such as iteration,
the four loop the while loop,

10
00:00:32.710 --> 00:00:37.440
specific data structures possibly
some simple data types as well.

11
00:00:37.440 --> 00:00:43.490
Like number, boolean, string, but
also lists and dictionaries and those.

12
00:00:43.490 --> 00:00:49.370
So this is meant to be kind of
this starting place, if you will.

13
00:00:49.370 --> 00:00:52.580
>> Okay, so
as a starting place a foundational series

14
00:00:52.580 --> 00:00:54.460
>> Would the target audience be

15
00:00:54.460 --> 00:00:55.900
somebody just starting out?

16
00:00:55.900 --> 00:00:59.030
>> Yeah this is definitely geared
toward individuals that have maybe

17
00:00:59.030 --> 00:01:00.530
never programmed before.

18
00:01:00.530 --> 00:01:02.500
Maybe even never seen code before.

19
00:01:02.500 --> 00:01:06.180
It's to get you started as
a necessary stepping stone for

20
00:01:06.180 --> 00:01:08.980
future understanding and education.

21
00:01:08.980 --> 00:01:10.410
Would respect to programming.

22
00:01:10.410 --> 00:01:15.880
>> Right, so this course specifically
had any in certification or

23
00:01:15.880 --> 00:01:18.300
any type of test that you could take.

24
00:01:18.300 --> 00:01:23.150
>> It does not it, its main purpose is to
get you comfortable with maybe the ins and

25
00:01:23.150 --> 00:01:28.240
outs of just basic programming
seeing some of these core concepts.

26
00:01:28.240 --> 00:01:34.960
In preparation to further engage in
learning future more complex topics.

27
00:01:34.960 --> 00:01:36.680
>> Wow,
it sounds like a great starting place for

28
00:01:36.680 --> 00:01:39.270
anybody just beginning in coding.

29
00:01:39.270 --> 00:01:42.710
And I will tell you that we're filming
this, after we've already done it,

30
00:01:42.710 --> 00:01:44.880
I learned a lot in this series.

31
00:01:44.880 --> 00:01:47.990
I feel like I've got a pretty
good handle on Python so.

32
00:01:47.990 --> 00:01:50.160
I hope you guys are looking
forward to this.

33
00:01:50.160 --> 00:01:52.521
And we will see you in
some episodes very soon.

34
00:01:52.521 --> 00:01:58.304
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne explore what is needed to get up and running with writing Python code. Additionally, Justin explores some of the alternatives for writing code.
episodes.title: Setting Up the Environment

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne explore the Read, Evaluate, Print, Loop (REPL) tool that is available with Python. Justin demonstrates and talks through some of the more common errors that people will encounter when first getting started.
episodes.title: Exploring the REPL

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne take a look at developing a way to thing about variables. Justin provides a mental model of variables as well as some details about how data is stored as well as naming conventions and requirements when creating a variable name.
episodes.title: Variables and Values

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne look at the difference between expressions and statements. Justin highlights some of the nuance details for considering if the Python code is a statement or an expression.
episodes.title: Expressions and Statements

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne return to the definition of a basic data types. Justin further explores how the "type" of information can affect the behavior of Python code.
episodes.title: Basic Data Types

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne dive further into using number types for data. Justin discusses the similarities and differences between integers and floats.
episodes.title: Basic Data Types: Numbers

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne explore the string data type. Justin explores some fo the common operations that strings are capable of as well as common uses of strings.
episodes.title: Basic Data Types: Strings

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne explore the boolean data type. Justin further explores the use of booleans and operations involving booleans as well as highlights the common uses of booleans.
episodes.title: Basic Data Types: Booleans

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne explore comparing data using basic data types such as number, string, and booleans. Justin explores which types of data are comparable and why you would want to compare data.
episodes.title: Compare Data

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne discuss how you can use logic control to create "smart" programs. Justin helps build a model of thinking for applying logical controls to programming.
episodes.title: Logic Control

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne take a look at the first construct that can be used to alter the flow of a program, the if statement.
episodes.title: If Statements

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne add to the if statement using the else statement to provide an alteration to how a program can flow.
episodes.title: if-Else Statements

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne look at another addition of if statements that will allow for more than "either-or" logic.
episodes.title: If-Elif-Else Statements

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne explore lists a little further. Moreover, Justin discusses the use cases and considerations when using lists as well as a couple of gotchas that may crop up.
episodes.title: Lists

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne continue their look into lists. Justin demonstrates the ability to change lists as well as some common methods that can be used with lists.
episodes.title: Lists Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne dive back into tuples as a way to arrange data in your program. Justin further discusses some of the operations that you can use when manipulating tuples.
episodes.title: Tuples

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne take a look at dictionaries that provide yet a different way to arranging data. Justin discusses when to use lists and tuples versus dictionaries as well as provides an overview of operations that you can use with dictionaries.
episodes.title: Dictionaries

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne take a look at dictionaries that provide yet a different way to arranging data. Justin discusses when to use lists and tuples versus dictionaries as well as provides an overview of operations that you can use with dictionaries.
episodes.title: Dictionaries Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne take a look at sets in the Python programming language. Justin discusses the uses of sets as well as explores operations that can be used with sets.
episodes.title: Sets

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne explore the concept of iteration and how that is important for programming.
episodes.title: What is Interation

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne take a look at the first iteration capability that you experience in Python, the for loop. Justin demonstrates how the for loop can be ability with or without and index as well as how to use the for loop for different iterable data types.
episodes.title: For Loops

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne discuss a different loop, the while loop. Justin explores some of the differences as well as highlights some other uses for the while loop.
episodes.title: While Loops

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne explore creating lists using loops. However, Python provides an alternative to using standard for loops to populate new lists, the list comprehension. Justin demonstrates the use of list comprehensions as well as compares the readability of list comprehensions versus creating lists using standard for loops.
episodes.title: List Comprehensions

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne review how to create dictionaries as well as how to use list comprehensions to create dictionaries. Justin then extends the usage to dictionary comprehensions as well as provides a comparison of readability of dictionary comprehensions to others.
episodes.title: Dictionary Comprehensions

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and  Vonne revisit the zip and range functions as a way of combining collections. Additionally, Justin demonstrates an additional iteration helper, enumerate.
episodes.title: Iteration Helpers
